intro: Oxydectes agraria, commonly known as the common oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine. Oxydectes agraria is an important plant for pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
